name: Introduction To 3D Crime Scene Mapping And Reconstruction
description: This course introduces students to both standard and innovative methods of documenting, mapping, analyzing, and visualizing/reconstructing a crime scene for investigative purposes, including: total stations; laser scanners; panoramic images; and photogrammetry. Course topics range from basic measurement theory and statistics, to legal considerations such as admissibility and preparing courtroom-ready visualizations. Students will learn to use forensic mapping software to create courtroom-ready graphics. [12L, 24P] (Priority given first to Forensic Science Specialists and Majors; then Minors.)
